qas.question: What do many birds use as a compass?
What does using the sun for direction involve?

answers.text: the need for making compensation based on the time

qas.question: What else is navigation based on?

answers.text: the ability to detect magnetic fields

context: Navigation is based on <a0_0>a variety of senses<a0_0/>. Many birds have been shown to use a <a1_0>sun<a1_0/> compass. Using the sun for direction involves <a2_0>the need for making compensation based on the time<a2_0/>. Navigation has also been shown to be based on a combination of other abilities including <a4_0>the ability to detect magnetic fields<a4_0/> (magnetoception), <a3_0>use visual landmarks<a3_0/> as well as olfactory cues.
